questions.question: A global company with a large number of AWS accounts is seeking a way in which they can centrally manage billing and security policies across all accounts. Which AWS Service will assist them in meeting these goals?
Which service provides object-level storage in AWS?

A company is concerned that they are spending money on underutilized compute resources in AWS. Which AWS feature will help ensure that their applications are automatically adding/removing EC2 compute capacity to closely match the required demand?
Which S3 storage class is best for data with unpredictable access patterns?
What is the AWS database service that allows you to upload data structured in key-value format?
Which of the following is NOT correct regarding Amazon EC2 On-demand instances?

options.A: You have to pay a start-up fee when launching a new instance for the first time.

options.B: The on-demand instances follow the AWS pay-as-you-go pricing model.

options.C: With on-demand instances, no longer-term commitments or upfront payments are needed.

options.D: When using on-demand Linux instances, you are charged per second based on an hourly rate.

questions.question: A company has moved to AWS recently. Which of the following AWS Services will help ensure that they have the proper security settings? (Choose TWO)
What is the AWS feature that provides an additional level of security above the default authentication mechanism of usernames and passwords?

A company is introducing a new product to their customers, and is expecting a surge in traffic to their web application. As part of their Enterprise Support plan, which of the following provides the company with architectural and scaling guidance?

You work as an on-premises MySQL DBA. The work of database configuration, backups, patching, and DR can be time-consuming and repetitive. Your company has decided to migrate to the AWS Cloud. Which of the following can help save time on database maintenance so you can focus on data architecture and performance?
Which of the below is a best-practice when designing solutions on AWS?

options.A: Invest heavily in architecting your environment, as it is not easy to change your design later.

options.B: Use AWS reservations to reduce costs when testing your production environment.

options.C: Automate wherever possible to make architectural (© ) experimentation easier.

options.D: Provision a large compute capacity to handle any spikes in load

questions.question: According to the AWS Acceptable Use Policy, which of the following statements is true regarding penetration testing of EC2 instances?

options.A: Penetration testing is not allowed in AWS.

options.B: Penetration testing is performed automatically by AWS to determine vulnerabilities in your AWS infrastructure.

options.C: Penetration testing can be performed by the customer on their own instances without prior authorization from AWS.

options.D: The AWS customers are only allowed to perform penetration testing on services managed by AWS.

questions.question: Which service is used to ensure that messages between software components are not lost if one or more components fail?
The principle “design for failure and nothing will fail” is very important when designing your AWS Cloud architecture. Which of the following would help adhere to this principle? (Choose TWO)
What is the AWS service that provides a virtual network dedicated to your AWS account?
According to the AWS Shared responsibility model, which of the following are the responsibility of the customer? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Managing environmental events of AWS data centers.

options.B: Protecting the confidentiality of data in transit in Amazon S3.

options.C: Controlling physical access to AWS Regions.

options.D: Ensuring that the underlying EC2 host is configured properly.

options.E: Patching applications installed on Amazon EC2.

options.B: An Ehcache compatible in-memory data store.

options.C: An online software store that allows Customers to launch pre-configured software with just few clicks.

options.D: A domain name system in the cloud.

options.A: Free support for all enterprise customers.

options.D: AWS holds responsibility for managing customer applications.

questions.question: Which of the following are important design principles you should adopt when designing systems on AWS? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Always use Global Services in your architecture rather than Regional Services.

options.B: Always choose to pay as you go.

questions.question: Which AWS Service can be used to establish a dedicated, private network connection between AWS and your datacenter?

Which of the following services can help protect your web applications from SQL injection and other vulnerabilities in your application code?
An organization needs to analyze and process a large number of data sets. Which AWS service should they use?

What are two advantages of using Cloud Computing over using traditional data centers? (Choose TWO)
Which of the following aspects of security are managed by AWS? (Choose TWO)

options.A: The ability of a system to recover gracefully from failure.

options.B: The efficient use of computing resources to meet requirements.

options.C: The ability to monitor systems and improve supporting processes and procedures.

options.D: The ability to manage datacenter operations more efficiently.

questions.question: AWS has created a large number of Edge Locations as part of its Global Infrastructure. Which of the following is NOT a benefit of using Edge Locations?

options.A: Edge locations are used by CloudFront to cache the most recent responses.

options.B: Edge locations are used by CloudFront to improve your end users’ experience when uploading files.

options.C: Edge locations are used by CloudFront to distribute traffic across multiple instances to reduce latency.

options.D: Edge locations are used by CloudFront to distribute content to global users with low latency.

options.A: Use the Import/Export feature to move old files automatically to Amazon Glacier.

options.B: Use the right combination of storage classes based on different use cases.

options.C: Pick the right Availability Zone for your S3 bucket.

options.D: Move all the data stored in S3 standard to EBS.

questions.question: What are the AWS services/features that can help you maintain a highly available and fault-tolerant architecture in AWS? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Enabling Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling for all of your workloads.

options.B: Using the AWS Network Load Balancer (NLB) to load balance the incoming HTTP requests.

options.C: Removing all of your Cost Allocation Tags.

options.D: Deploying your AWS resources across multiple Availability Zones.

A company has created a solution that helps AWS customers improve their architectures on AWS. Which AWS program may support this company?
What is the AWS serverless service that allows you to run your applications without any administrative burden?

options.A: She has properly built an elastic system.

options.B: She has properly built a fault tolerant system.

options.C: She has properly built an encrypted system.

options.D: She has properly built a scalable system.

options.C: Ensuring that users have received security training in the use of AWS services.

options.D: Ensuring that access to data centers is restricted.

options.E: Ensuring that hardware is disposed of properly.

options.B: Configuring AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles.

questions.question: Under the shared responsibility model which of the following areas are the customer’s responsibility? (Select TWO)
A company is looking for a scalable data warehouse solution. Which of the following AWS solutions would meet the company’s needs?
Much AWS services provide a way to extend an on-premises architecture to the AWS Cloud? (Select TWO)
What are the advantages of the AWS Cloud (Select TWO)

options.B: No need to guess capacity requirements.

options.E: Physical access to cloud data centers.

questions.question: How can the AWS Cloud increase user workforce productivity after migration from an on-premises data center?

options.A: Users do not have to wait for infrastructure provisioning.

options.B: The AWS Cloud infrastructure is much faster than an on-premises data center infrastructure.

options.C: AWS takes over application configuration management on behalf of users.

options.D: Users do not need to address security and compliance issues.

questions.question: Which of the following services could be used to deploy an application to servers running on-premises? (Select TWO)
What is an example of agility in the AWS Cloud?

options.C: Using Consolidated Billing to produce one bill.

options.D: Decreased acquisition time for new compute resources.

questions.question: Which AWS security service protects applications from distributed denial of service attacks with always-on detection and automatic inline mitigations?
Which of the following are advantages of AWS consolidated billing? (Choose two)

options.A: The ability to receive one bill for multiple accounts.

options.B: Service limits increasing by default in all accounts.

options.C: A fixed discount on the monthly bill.

options.D: Potential volume discounts, as usage in all accounts is combined.

options.E: The automatic extension of the master account’s AWS support plan to all accounts.

questions.question: A company is considering using AWS for a self-hosted database that requires a nightly shutdown for maintenance and cost-saving purposes. Which service should the company use?

options.C: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) with Amazon EC2 instance store.

options.D: Amazon EC2 with Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS).
